To oversee the work of the intelligence analytical community across government, so as to ensure the development of necessary capabilities and skills.

Job Title: Efficiency Cluster Lead and Chief Procurement Officer for Government

Government’s Chief Procurement Officer (CPO) leads the Efficiency Cluster in delivering efficiency savings and is responsible for:
-The Government Procurement Service: buying £8bn of goods and services for the public sector each year and to aggregate, and where appropriate centralise, spend across all government departments.
-Procurement Policy: all cross cutting policy affecting the £44bn spent each year by Whitehall, including EU engagement and ensuring SMEs have fair access to Government contracts.
-Commercial Relationships:  Building strategic relationships with key suppliers to deliver cost reductions, performance improvements and ideas for reforming public service delivery. 
-Reviewing how Government does business,  i.e. contract, for  large and  complex services, and support renegotiation of such contracts with HMG.
